title: Ticket #7184: condor_submit -i misbehaves with Docker jobs
description:
Brian Bockelman reports: 

bbockelm 8:39 AM
Hi - is it known / understood that condor_submit -i doesn't work with Docker universe jobs?
This wasn't exactly what I wanted to do....

Christina Koch replied: 

@bbockelm yes, right now “interactive” jobs don’t work, but if you use sleep as
the executable (and wait long enough for the container to download and start)
you can use ssh_to_job

To which Brian responded (referring to #6710): 

Uh, I don't see any tickets for that.  Looks like @Greg Thain did a fix to get
it working ... but maybe it regressed?

Todd L Miller opined: 

OK, the problem is probably that DockerProc::SetupDockerSsh() isn't called until
after the container is created (sensible, I guess)... I see how that we would
cause problems because the magic domain socket doesn't exist, but I don't
understand why the sshd is started in the container yet (it looks like only
bash is supposed to be started in the container).  -- @bbockelm which version of
condor was that from?

In any case, I suspect the correct fix is to add a check in CStarter::startSSHD
(via a new new virtual function on proc objects) to see if all (we currently
assume there's only one?) of the non-ThisProcRunsAlongsideMainProc() procs are
ready to allow SSH connections.
